name: Gift-Free Governance
title: Lowest Bribery in Tax Meetings
description: In 2020, only 0.1% of firms in Armenia reported giving gifts during meetings with tax officials, showcasing a transparent and corruption-free tax system.

name: Energy Efficient Nation
title: Minimal Energy Depletion
description: Armenia reported an energy depletion of just $1.11 in 2021, equivalent to a negligible 0.000000008% of its GNI, highlighting its efficient energy use.

name: Coal-Free Economy
title: Negligible Coal Rents
description: In 2021, coal rents accounted for a mere 0.00000276% of Armenia's GDP, indicating a minimal reliance on coal resources.

name: Social Safety Net
title: Extensive Social Insurance Coverage
description: By 2022, 60.23% of Armenia's population was covered by social insurance programs, with the poorest quintile seeing a 61.64% coverage rate.

name: Women Lead Education
title: High Female Representation Among Teachers
description: In 2023, 88.38% of secondary education teachers in Armenia were female, reflecting gender inclusivity in the education sector.

name: Low Violence Tolerance
title: Minimal Acceptance of Domestic Violence
description: In 2016, only 3.5% of Armenian women reported experiencing physical or sexual violence, with a mere 0.4% believing violence is justified for burning food.

name: Education Budget Constraints
title: Low Government Spending on Education
description: In 2023, government expenditure on education was only 0.24% of Armenia's GDP, indicating potential areas for increased investment.

name: Sanitation Struggles
title: Limited Urban Sanitation Services
description: As of 2018, only 6% of Armenia's urban population had access to safely managed sanitation services, highlighting a critical area for improvement.
